4.11.23  11:56 pm   do you have a go-to program for music production? i'm interested in it but have no idea where to begin

4.11.23  2:29 pm   Sometimes I get crazy when it comes to prepositions. I say something like, "I was at home at three o'clock" and it drives me nuts because of the two ats so close together. I'm even tempted to use the wrong preposition--"I was in home at three o'clock"--just to smooth it over. But I usually just rewrite the sentence entirely.

Has this ever happened to you, Bill?

4.11.23  10:29 am   can you explain your process for mentally figuring out the hex codes for colors again? i remember seeing your explanation for it once before a few years ago but have since forgotten it

      it's R G B. the first 2 digits are red, the middle two are green, the last two are blue. And each of these 3 sections runs on a scale from 00 to FF, in hexidecimal that means 0 to 16, with 00 being the lowest and FF being the highest. So if you know how to mix RGB then you're all set. bright red is FF0000. bright green is 00FF00. pure blue is 0000FF. black is 000000. white is FFFFFF. medium grey is like 888888. bright magenta is FF00FF. etc

4.10.23  7:53 pm   i enjoy making up new sounds using the software i have, but i have a problem am asking for advice:
i don't know when to stop editing the sound and consider it "a sonud". what i mean is , i'll take a guitar sound and ill think okay lets edit this, so i'll change the fret position or i'll change the microphones, or i'll tune it up a little bit, but then i'll think okay well thats great, but when i do the same thing for a bass, it's unuseable unless i put an EQ and a compressor to sustain it. so how do i know when the sound is a sound, and not a sound PLUS mixing.. i just want to know how far to go before saving the patch or track settings for later.

     there's no good answer. some will be undercooked. some will be overcooked. you're never gonna get an exact answer for this. your collection will contain a variety

     i like using those made up sounds for later but i tend to want thenm to be playable in their final mixed state so i keep everything as midi and never convert to audio but when i do convert to audio mixing is a zillion times easier

     it sounds like you are doing great

4.10.23  7:13 pm   which end do i open a banana from

4.10.23  6:41 pm   Hey Bill, first time on this website, but I've seen people ask for advice on here so...might as well do the same. I've always wanted to draw, I see my sister and her drawings, and I just dream of doing the same thing. I wanna have a new talent. I feel like I'm ready to start learning, but I get scared and I just don't bother doing it. Has this ever happened to you?

     sort of

      If so, or if not, how do I overcome this feeling of fear and lack of motivation?

     wanting to do it is motivation. if you didn't have motivation then you wouldn't want to do it, and you wouldn't be here asking this. but i think what you are experiencing is like what home-owners experience when they feel like their neighbors lawn is always a brigher shade of green than their own. it's not really true, but it's a common feeling to have. i don't know of a direct solution for this, but simply knowing about this phenomenon is helpful. i'm sure there are things that other people see in you that they wish they had

4.9.23  7:58 pm   Comment on a song you've heard recently but don't tell us which song you're talking about

4.9.23  7:51 pm   If I had a chord progression that was essentially a vamp between Cm9 and Bmaj7/Db, would it make sense to go to F#maj7 after that and do somthing like u did in "when I get older" where you go between F#maj7 and Abmaj7add6 ?

     only you would know that, because only you know how you are making that sound. what's even more important is what you have for melody/words/context

     Or would you in this situation instead move into a new key using Gmaj7/A as a stepping stone, kinda like the harmonic movement in the "Stay for a while" bit in "if the world doesn't end". This movement would open up the possibility to modulate to D but idk enough music theory to go somewhere other than that with the suspended voicing of A major which is Gmaj7/A 

     most of the time you'll probably come up empty handed if you are trying to draw the entire road map using chords alone. the important turns usually want to be guided by all available context elements, together (words, melody, chord, the whole sound, the whole context, everything that's going on)

4.9.23  7:10 pm   How do you like your eggs?
